cont.entity_a: Works well as a backup device on a 64-bit Windows server. Experienced data loss after a few years due to disk corruption. Failed to complete backups later.
cont.entity_b: Drive occasionally fails to power up or be recognized.

cont.entity_a: Operates quietly. Quiet operation with cloth underneath to dampen sound.

Initial setup requires connecting via USB before switching to Firewire. No installation required, but formatting is necessary. Reformatting to NTFS wipes pre-installed software, which needs to be re-downloaded. Drive installation is simple and quick.
cont.entity_b: USB interface works well, but eSATA can cause system lockups. eSATA cable not included, needed for DVR connection.

cont.entity_a: Pre-installed WD backup software is not impressive. Backup software is fast and easy to use. The drive's performance is excellent but lacks pre-installed backup software.
cont.entity_b: Drive has a large storage capacity but includes unnecessary software.

cont.entity_a: The drive is stylish and modern. Attractive design fits well in office settings.
Initial performance was good, but the drive became erratic with overheating.
cont.entity_b: The eSATA connection is extremely fast. Write speed is slower compared to WD 500 GB.

cont.entity_a: Heats up during video rendering but remains silent.
cont.entity_b: Runs very hot even when off.

cont.entity_a: Drive failure occurred after a year of light use. Drive failure and data loss reported after a year.
Dual interface is useful, especially for Mac users.
cont.entity_b: The eSATA connector is incompatible with some chipsets. Firmware update released to address eSATA issues.

cont.entity_a: Offers a good amount of memory for the price.
cont.entity_b: Actual storage space is less than advertised.

cont.entity_a: Can cause Windows XP shutdown issues. Issues with automatic shutdown when turning off the computer.
cont.entity_b: The power button is unreliable. Issues with the power supply reported.

cont.entity_a: Western Digital support was unhelpful in resolving issues.
cont.entity_b: Seagate's replacement policy offers refurbished drives.

Compatibility.comm: Good compatibility with both Windows and Mac.

cont.entity_b: Drive works well on Mac but has an uncomfortable on/off button.
Drive not in stock as advertised by Amazon.
